text: London’s National Portrait Gallery is currently celebrating the fifty year  career  of photographer Sandra Lousada. The twenty one portraits on display depict key  figures  in literature, film and fashion from the early 1960s. Subsequent to the acquisition of forty portraits by Lousada, the  display  at The National Portrait Gallery highlights shots taken between 1960 and 1964, many of which feature in Lousada’s book Public Faces Private Places (2008).
